intro: Calathodes palmata var. appendiculata, commonly known as the appendiculate calathodes, is a rare and lesser-known plant species within the family Arecaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into multiple lobes resembling a hand, and its clustered inflorescences that bear small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphological features make it an interesting subject for botanical study, though it remains under-researched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
